newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-MANCHESTER CITY ROCKED BY FOUR-GOAL LINCOLN.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-MANCHESTER CITY ROCKED BY FOUR-GOAL LINCOLN.

text.p: Third division Lincoln added to Manchester City's misery with a shock 4-1 English League Cup second round win over the managerless first division club on Tuesday.
Luton beat premier league Derby 1-0 in their first leg clash and Tottenham were held 1-1 at Preston, another second division side.

Manchester City, relegated from the top flight last season and without a major trophy since 1976, looked set for a comfortable outing when German striker Uwe Rosler put them ahead after only four minutes.
But Terry Fleming, Steve Holmes, Dutchman Gilbert Bos and Jon Whitney all replied.
Julian James was Luton's hero with a 26th minute winner.

Michael Holt, a close-season free transfer from Blackburn, netted the first goal of his professional career in the last minute as Preston cancelled out Darren Anderton's second minute opener for Tottenham.
Blackburn scraped their first victory of the season with a 2-1 triumph over second division leaders Brentford.
Garry Flitcroft and Chris Sutton, with his third goal in as many games, netted for the struggling premier league club before Nicky Forster pulled one back for Brentford.
